comments.body: When adding types for a major version and bumping the major version, we should create types for the previous major version. See https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped#if-a-library-is-updated-to-a-new-major-version-with-breaking-changes-how-should-i-update-its-type-declaration-package for details on how to do that. The tl;dr is to copy the existing types into a `v1/` directory and make a couple of tweaks to `v1/tsconfg.json`. The instructions I linked describe what to do in detail with an example. After you have done that, you can bump the version and make these changes in the root `types/ember__test-helpers/` directory.

@jamescdavis  Ok I tried different permutations of paths and couldn't get it to work.
Can you help with the error `Expected directory ember__test-helpers/v1 to be the path mapping for ember__test-helpers`?
Also is adding new functions considered a breaking change?

The issue I have with adding these methods and bumping the major version of these types without splitting off a v1 is that then we don't have a way to back port types fixes for folks using 1.x. I'll see if I can track down why it was failing.
